Indicator_Computation: Compute z-score of the change in short-rate differential Δ(US2Y−DE2Y) over lookback L (e.g., 5–20 bars).
Signal_Logic: If z ≥ +z_th → USD-positive bias (e.g., short EURUSD); if z ≤ −z_th → USD-negative bias.
Notes: For other pairs, swap relevant sovereign 2Y yields.

Indicator_Computation: Slope(front→back) of US OIS minus EU OIS, normalized to z.
Signal_Logic: Steepening US vs. flat EU (z ≥ z_th) → USD-positive bias gate.
Notes: Replace provider with your source; daily recompute is fine.

Indicator_Computation: Short-rate differential or 1m forward points transformed to z-score.
Signal_Logic: Positive carry above z_th enables longer-horizon trend following in high-yield FX.

Indicator_Computation: Observed futures price minus theoretical forward (CIP), normalized to z.
Signal_Logic: Large |z| ⇒ inefficiency/stress; consider mean reversion or caution gate.

Indicator_Computation: Residual = futures_return − β·spot_return; normalize to z.
Signal_Logic: Positive residual implies spot catch-up; bias toward futures direction.

Indicator_Computation: z-score of ΔVIX with optional 1–3 bar lags.
Signal_Logic: High VIX_Z gates risk-off plays (long JPY/CHF; short AUD/NZD).

Indicator_Computation: 25-delta call–put IV differential or ETF proxy; rolling z.
Signal_Logic: Persistent positive USD RR ⇒ USD upside bias filter.

Indicator_Computation: Composite of breadth, realized vol change, and momentum across SPX/DAX/NKY; map to −1/0/+1.
Signal_Logic: Risk-on (+1) favors AUD/NZD; risk-off (−1) favors JPY/CHF.

Indicator_Computation: Commodity momentum + term slope (front–back), normalized by ATR into z.
Signal_Logic: WTI↑ supports CAD; Copper↑ supports AUD; Gold may support XAU/USD risk views.
Notes: Map commodity to FX pair explicitly.

Indicator_Computation: Level and changes in spreads; z-score.
Signal_Logic: Widening (z ≥ th) → risk-off bias; suppress breakout longs in risk FX.
Notes: Daily suffice; use as macro filter.

Indicator_Computation: (Net specs / OI) z-scored vs 52w history.
Signal_Logic: Extremes signal crowding; favor mean-reversion or tighten TP.

Indicator_Computation: Weighted tick counts plus spread index across multiple feeds; normalize 0–1.
Signal_Logic: Low score (thin/wide) ⇒ avoid entries or widen stops; high ⇒ okay for breakouts.

Indicator_Computation: Blend of tick volume, spread, and optional futures volume into 0–1 score.
Signal_Logic: Low depth ⇒ suppress mean-reversion; high depth ⇒ enable breakouts.

Indicator_Computation: (Long−Short)/OpenInterest normalized to z.
Signal_Logic: Extreme positive/negative values ⇒ contrarian risk or pause add-ons.
Notes: Subset of COT_NET_Z if you split components.

Indicator_Computation: Long/(Long+Short) or Longs/Shorts.
Signal_Logic: At extremes (e.g., >0.75 long), prefer contrarian short bias; inverse for shorts.
Notes: Smooth with EMA to reduce noise.

Indicator_Computation: Z-scored divergence between COT net trend and retail ratio trend.
Signal_Logic: Divergence spikes suggest turning points; use as alert/gate.
Notes: Compute slope difference via rolling regression.

Indicator_Computation: ETF net inflows plus futures OI/net longs trend composite.
Signal_Logic: Inflows + rising OI with price up ⇒ boost long conviction (and vice versa).

Indicator_Computation: Weighted blend of institutional z, retail ratio z, and divergence z.
Signal_Logic: PRI ≥ +1 → contrarian short bias; PRI ≤ −1 → contrarian long bias.

Indicator_Computation: Compare VIX to MA/thresholds; output −1/0/+1 state.
Signal_Logic: Enable/disable strategies depending on regime (e.g., breakouts only in 0/+1).

Indicator_Computation: CUSUM-style break detection on any feature series; returns break flag + confidence.
Signal_Logic: On break, reset models/thresholds; temporarily suppress signals.
Notes: Generic utility; specify source per use.

Indicator_Computation: Rolling correlation vs. history; z-normalized; breakdown flag when unstable.
Signal_Logic: If unstable, down-weight or disable cross-asset signals.
Notes: Define what constitutes 'unstable' for your stack.

Indicator_Computation: Blend breakout clarity, ATR vs range, MA alignment, news impact, volume confirm into 0–1 score.
Signal_Logic: MOI>0.8 → fade obvious move; 0.3–0.8 neutral; <0.3 confusion (reduce size).

Indicator_Computation: Sentiment extremes + RSI divergence + repeated S/R tests + VIX complacency blended to 0–1.
Signal_Logic: COI>0.75: contrarians overcrowded (trap risk). COI<0.4: contrarian plays safer.
Notes: Use as a filter, not a standalone entry.

Indicator_Computation: Price–volume divergence, off-hours impulse, large-block ratio, option-flow skew to 0–1 score.
Signal_Logic: SMAI>0.7 follow smart-money; <0.3 retail-dominated (fade spikes).
Notes: Block/option flow availability varies by venue.

Indicator_Computation: Density estimate around round numbers, key highs/lows, breakout & trailing-stop halos.
Signal_Logic: High density near price ⇒ stop-run risk; target or avoid accordingly.

Indicator_Computation: Broker bullish/bearish percent smoothed by EMA.
Signal_Logic: Bullish>80% ⇒ short bias; Bearish>80% ⇒ long bias.

Indicator_Computation: Composite score: time-of-day, proximity to S/R, rising volume, and SCD.
Signal_Logic: Prepare stop-through entries to run clusters; reverse on exhaustion signal.

Indicator_Computation: Combine MOI/COI/SMAI and pain-trade probability into categorical regime.
Signal_Logic: L1+high MOI→Fade Obvious; L2+high COI→Fade Contrarians; L3+high SMAI→Follow Smart Money.
Notes: Define mapping table explicitly in code.

Concept: Friday time-window absolute percent move (07:30→14:00 CT)
Indicator_Computation: % change between price at 07:30 and 14:00 (America/Chicago) on Fridays.
Signal_Logic: After 14:00, if abs(%Δ) ≥ threshold, emit one-shot LONG if Δ>0, SHORT if Δ<0.

Indicator_Computation: Sign of Friday window move Δ (07:30→14:00 CT).
Signal_Logic: Allow only longs (or shorts) when sign matches configured bias.

Indicator_Computation: Real-time ratio |%Δ_so_far| / threshold before 14:00.
Signal_Logic: If proximity near 1.0, arm execution and alert; does not execute by itself.

Indicator_Computation: Count of symbols where FRI_MOVE_PCT qualifies; compute ratio N/M.
Signal_Logic: Only execute if N/M ≥ configured min_confluence.

Indicator_Computation: Pin strength of spot vs large strikes into expiry (0–1).
Signal_Logic: High pin score → mean-reversion toward strike.

Indicator_Computation: Distance from nearest large OI strike normalized by ATR/pips.
Signal_Logic: Treat wall as S/R; fade into wall, require strength to break through.

Indicator_Computation: Escape from strike cluster shortly after the cut.
Signal_Logic: Enable stop-through momentum entries post-expiry.

Indicator_Computation: Pre-cut realized vol/ATR compression flag.
Signal_Logic: Expect expansion after the cut; enable breakout strategies.

Indicator_Computation: Boolean indicating if any expiry effects are live.
Signal_Logic: Gate other strategies while true.

Indicator_Computation: Composite strength score of active expiry effects.
Signal_Logic: Use threshold (e.g., >50) to boost or permit setups.

Indicator_Computation: Categorical summary: pinning vs breakout vs neutral.
Signal_Logic: Use phase to choose execution style (limit-into-pin vs stop-through).

Indicator_Computation: Map |FRI_MOVE_PCT| to 0–1 scalar (clamped).
Signal_Logic: Use scalar to scale lot size/SL distance for Friday executions.

Indicator_Computation: Boolean/score when FridayMove qualifies AND ExpiryStrength > cut.
Signal_Logic: Execute only if both conditions true; else downweight/block.
